title: stage0.txt: Shouldn't "dev: 1" be commented out for a stable release?

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

labels.name: T-infra
labels.description: Relevant to the infrastructure team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
At least according the the comments in stage0.txt.

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/766bd11c8a3c019ca53febdcd77b2215379dd67d/src/stage0.txt#L37


I am compiling rust 1.23.0 from 1.22.1, and it gives me the following errors:

```
Compiling core v0.0.0 (file:///data2/build/rust-1.23.0/rustc-1.23.0-src/src/libcore)
error: expected one of `)` or `,`, found `=`
    --> src/libcore/slice/mod.rs:1049:13
     |
1049 |         (0..=self.end).get(slice)
     |             ^ expected one of `)` or `,` here

error: expected one of `)` or `,`, found `=`
    --> src/libcore/slice/mod.rs:1054:13
     |
1054 |         (0..=self.end).get_mut(slice)
     |             ^ expected one of `)` or `,` here

error: expected one of `)` or `,`, found `=`
    --> src/libcore/slice/mod.rs:1059:13
     |
1059 |         (0..=self.end).get_unchecked(slice)
     |             ^ expected one of `)` or `,` here

error: expected one of `)` or `,`, found `=`
    --> src/libcore/slice/mod.rs:1064:13
     |
1064 |         (0..=self.end).get_unchecked_mut(slice)
     |             ^ expected one of `)` or `,` here

error: expected one of `)` or `,`, found `=`
    --> src/libcore/slice/mod.rs:1069:13
     |
1069 |         (0..=self.end).index(slice)
     |             ^ expected one of `)` or `,` here

error: expected one of `)` or `,`, found `=`
    --> src/libcore/slice/mod.rs:1074:13
     |
1074 |         (0..=self.end).index_mut(slice)
     |             ^ expected one of `)` or `,` here
```
